Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk tog-pegasus
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: tog-pegasus bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated tog-pegasus packages that fix several bugs and add various enhancements are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. OpenPegasus Web-Based Enterprise Management (WBEM) Services for Linux enables management solutions that deliver increased control of enterprise resources. WBEM is a platform and resource independent of Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF) standard that defines a common information model and communication protocol for monitoring and controlling resources from diverse sources.
The top-pegasus packages have been upgraded to upstream version 2.14.1. The updated version provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1097187)
This update also fixes the following bugs:
* When using the previous version of OpenPegasus Common Information Model (CIM) server, the Single Network Management Protocol version 3 (SNMPv3) trap was in some cases not sent properly and the "Snmp Indication Handler failed to send the trap" error message was logged. This update ensures that using an SNMPv3 trap properly triggers the snmpv3_engineID_probe() function, and the described problem no longer occurs. (BZ#1218954)
* Previously, it was not possible to compile sample OpenPegasus providers, and the following error occurred:
Error adding class CIM_Component to the repository
This bug has been fixed, and providers are now able to compile successfully. (BZ#1127399)
Users of tog-pegasus are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix several bugs and add various enhancements.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
